required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Experience of Arab American Women With Breast Cancer: In-depth Interviews
clinical_study.official_title: Experience of Arab American Women With Breast Cancer: In-depth Interviews A Qualitative Study to Explore the Influence of the Arab Culture on Coping With Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are conducting a study entitled 'Experience of Arab American Women with Breast Cancer: In-depth Interviews' through which they hope to learn more about Arab women's experience with breast cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Understanding the influence of Arab culture on health behavior
primary_outcome.description: particularly with regard to breast cancer by in-depth interviews

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arab American Women with Breast Cancer
arm_group.description: We conducted a study using an evaluation assessment survey to assess the impact of the AMBER support groups on quality of life parameters, compliance with treatment appointments, and patient/family support. After reviewing preliminary results, we identified several recurrent themes, such as the need for health information, discrepancies around the extent of family support and disease disclosure, and an overall satisfaction with the support groups. To further examine these themes, we are initiating a qualitative research study using an in-depth interview guide. A trained interviewer bilingual in Arabic and English will conduct 10-15 in-depth interviews, to saturation, with AMBER's support group participants over a 6 month period.

intervention.description: The study involves a one-time qualitative assessment to explore key cultural influences on AMBER breast cancer survivors' health behavior. We will focus on self-efficacy in healthcare, coping with breast cancer, social networks of support, and culturally-sensitive support groups. The study investigator will administer questions from the structured interview guide, estimated to take 90 minutes.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arab American Women with Breast Cancer

study_pop.textblock: This study is open to current and previous AMBER support group participants held at the MSK Brooklyn Infusion Center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AMBER participant diagnosed with breast cancer who attended at least 1 support group meeting
- Aged 18 to 85
- Arabic-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:

clinical_study.keyword: The Arab American Breast Cancer Education and Referral Program (AMBER)
